llm.feedback: The draft meets the 4‑line mover requirement but the probabilities and citations need tightening: the second “Up” line cites FAN5RYW6T but assigns 50 % without a clear numeric basis; reduce to 30 % (the alternative scenario is a modest gain, not a 50 % upside). The two “Down” lines are fine, but the 30 % Down should be tied to the sticky‑inflation/no‑cut scenario (FAN5RYW6T) and the 20 % Down to the unexpected‑rate‑hike scenario (3YAQ8JUPL). The swing‑trade line is mis‑ordered and mis‑calculated: swap Invalidation and Trigger, set Invalidation to “Fed cuts fail / inflation > 2.6 %” (3YAQ8JUPL), keep Trigger as “Fed minutes dovish” (B1KYJ1GPU)(3YAQ8JUPL)(97MD1FHW8), correct R/R to 4:1 (target 4,200, stop 3,950), and cite the probability 70 % with 97MD1FHW8. Use the canonical handle spx, keep the entry at 4,000 only if that is the current level; otherwise adjust to the latest close. Drop any extraneous text, ensure each line follows the exact format, and keep the confidence at 70 % to reflect the moderate‑high base‑case certainty.
